title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement Ramiro Magno. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

what: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Guescini et al. (2008)
title: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Guescini et al. (2008)
text: guescini R data package provides real-time PCR raw fluorescence data Guescini et al. (2008) tidy format.

title: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Guescini et al. (2008)
text: Install guescini CRAN:

title: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Guescini et al. (2008)
text: Guescini et al. (2008) explored effect amplification inhibition qPCR quantification. Two systems devised alter amplification efficiency: decreasing amplification mix used reaction increasing IgG (PCR inhibitor) concentration reaction raw fluorescence data associated decreasing amplification mix provided data set amp_mix_perc; data obtained increasing concentrations IgG provided IgG_inhibition.

title: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Guescini et al. (2008)
text: data set amp_mix_perc corresponds set amplification runs MT-ND1 gene amplified reactions initial amount DNA different amounts SYBR Green Master mix. standard curve performed wide range input DNA (3.14 × 107 thru 3.14 × 101) presence optimal amplification conditions (100% amplification mix), unknowns run presence starting DNA amounts amplification mix quantities ranging 60% 100%.
code: library(guescini) amp_mix_perc #> # A tibble: 21,000 × 12 #>    plate well  dye   target sample_type run   replicate amp_mix_perc   copies #>    <fct> <fct> <fct> <fct>  <fct>       <fct> <fct>            <dbl>    <int> #>  1 <NA>  <NA>  SYBR  MT-ND1 std         1     1                    1 31400000 #>  2 <NA>  <NA>  SYBR  MT-ND1 std         1     1                    1 31400000 #>  3 <NA>  <NA>  SYBR  MT-ND1 std         1     1                    1 31400000 #>  4 <NA>  <NA>  SYBR  MT-ND1 std         1     1                    1 31400000 #>  5 <NA>  <NA>  SYBR  MT-ND1 std         1     1                    1 31400000 #>  6 <NA>  <NA>  SYBR  MT-ND1 std         1     1                    1 31400000 #>  7 <NA>  <NA>  SYBR  MT-ND1 std         1     1                    1 31400000 #>  8 <NA>  <NA>  SYBR  MT-ND1 std         1     1                    1 31400000 #>  9 <NA>  <NA>  SYBR  MT-ND1 std         1     1                    1 31400000 #> 10 <NA>  <NA>  SYBR  MT-ND1 std         1     1                    1 31400000 #> # ℹ 20,990 more rows #> # ℹ 3 more variables: dilution <int>, cycle <int>, fluor <dbl>  amp_mix_perc %>%   ggplot(mapping = aes(     x = cycle,     y = fluor,     group = interaction(run, amp_mix_perc, copies),     col = format(copies, big.mark = ",", scientific = FALSE)   )) +   geom_line(linewidth = 0.2) +   geom_point(size = 0.2) +   labs(y = "Raw fluorescence", colour = "No. of copies", title = "Seven-point 10-fold dilution series amplification mix percentage") +   guides(color = guide_legend(override.aes = list(linewidth = 0.5), reverse = TRUE)) +   facet_wrap(vars(amp_mix_perc))

title: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Guescini et al. (2008)
text: data set IgG_inhibition provides runs performed presence optimal amplification reaction mix added serial dilutions IgG (0.0 - 2 ug/ml) thus acting inhibitory agent.
code: IgG_inhibition %>%   ggplot(mapping = aes(     x = cycle,     y = fluor,     group = interaction(IgG_conc, replicate),     col = paste(as.character(IgG_conc), "ug/ml")   )) +   geom_line(linewidth = 0.5) +   geom_point(size = 0.5) +   labs(y = "Raw fluorescence", colour = "IgG concentration", title = "Serial dilutions of IgG (PCR inhibitor)") +   guides(color = guide_legend(override.aes = list(linewidth = 0.5)))

title: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Guescini et al. (2008)
text: Please note guescini project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Guescini et al. (2008)
text: Michele Guescini, Davide Sisti, Marco BL Rocchi, Laura Stocchi Vilberto Stocchi. new real-time PCR method overcome significant quantitative inaccuracy due slight amplification inhibition. BMC Bioinformatics 9:326 (2008). doi: 10.1186/1471-2105-9-326.

title: IgG inhibition — IgG_inhibition
text: data set set quantitative real-time PCR runs performed presence optimal amplification reaction mix added serial dilutions IgG (0.0, 0.25, 0.50, 1.0, 2.0 μg/ml) thus acting inhibitory agent. two replicates concentration IgG. concentration amplicon ND1/ND2 41,700,000 copies. Please read Methods section Guescini et al. (2008) details.

title: IgG inhibition — IgG_inhibition
text: tibble 400 rows 10 variables: plate Plate identifier. well Well identifier. Values always NA (available). variable kept nevertheless coherent data sets similar R data packages. dye type dye used. data set values always "SYBR", meaning SYBR Green master mix (Roche). target Target identifier: amplicon used, "MT_ND1". sample_type Sample type (curves standards, .e. "std"). replicate Replicate identifier: 1 thru 3. IgG_conc IgG concentration μg/ml. copies Standard copy number. cycle PCR cycle. fluor Raw fluorescence values.

title: IgG inhibition — IgG_inhibition
code: IgG_inhibition #> # A tibble: 400 × 10 #>    plate well  dye   target sample_type replicate copies IgG_conc cycle    fluor #>    <fct> <fct> <fct> <fct>  <fct>           <int>  <int>    <dbl> <int>    <dbl> #>  1 NA    NA    SYBR  ND1/N… std                 1 4.17e7        0     1 -6.28e-2 #>  2 NA    NA    SYBR  ND1/N… std                 1 4.17e7        0     2  3.24e-3 #>  3 NA    NA    SYBR  ND1/N… std                 1 4.17e7        0     3 -7.34e-5 #>  4 NA    NA    SYBR  ND1/N… std                 1 4.17e7        0     4 -3.87e-3 #>  5 NA    NA    SYBR  ND1/N… std                 1 4.17e7        0     5  2.61e-4 #>  6 NA    NA    SYBR  ND1/N… std                 1 4.17e7        0     6  4.45e-4 #>  7 NA    NA    SYBR  ND1/N… std                 1 4.17e7        0     7  3.84e-3 #>  8 NA    NA    SYBR  ND1/N… std                 1 4.17e7        0     8  1.43e-2 #>  9 NA    NA    SYBR  ND1/N… std                 1 4.17e7        0     9  1.84e-2 #> 10 NA    NA    SYBR  ND1/N… std                 1 4.17e7        0    10  7.47e-2 #> # ℹ 390 more rows

title: Amplification mix percentage — amp_mix_perc
text: data set set quantitative real-time PCR runs targets amplification sequence MT-ND1 gene, seven-point, ten-fold serial dilution starting 3.14 x 10^7 copies DNA molecules. addition, range amplification mix quantities ranging 60% 100% also performed. results 5 serial dilutions, one amplification mix quantity (0.6, 0.7, 0.8, 0.9 1.0). Please read Methods section Guescini et al. (2008) details. data set comprises seven-point, ten-fold dilution series, repeated 12 independent runs targeting amplicon MT-ND1 gene. slight amplification inhibition quantitative real-time PCR experiments obtained using two systems: decreasing amplification mix (amp_mix_perc) used reaction adding varying amounts IgG, known PCR inhibitor. Please read Methods section Guescini et al. (2008) details.

title: Amplification mix percentage — amp_mix_perc
text: tibble 21,000 rows 12 variables: plate Plate identifier. well Well identifier. Values always NA (available). variable kept nevertheless coherent data sets similar R data packages. dye type dye used. data set values always "SYBR", meaning SYBR Green master mix (Roche). target Target identifier: amplicon used, "MT_ND1". sample_type Sample type (curves standards, .e. "std"). run variable discriminates amplification curves within group defined amp_mix_perc copies. Range: 1 thru 12. replicate Replicate identifier: 1 thru 3. amp_mix_perc Amplification mix percentage. copies Standard copy number. dilution Dilution factor. Higher number means greater dilution. cycle PCR cycle. fluor Raw fluorescence values. tibble 21,000 rows 11 variables: plate Plate identifier. well Well identifier. Values always NA (available). variable kept nevertheless coherent data sets similar R data packages. dye type dye used. data set values always "SYBR", meaning SYBR Green master mix (Roche). target Target identifier: amplicon used, "MT_ND1". sample_type Sample type (curves standards, .e. "std"). replicate Replicate identifier: 1 thru 3. amp_mix_perc Amplification mix percentage. copies Standard copy number. dilution Dilution factor. Higher number means greater dilution. cycle PCR cycle. fluor Raw fluorescence values.

ℹ 20,990 more rows #> # ℹ 3 more variables: dilution <int>, cycle <int>, fluor <dbl>  amp_mix_perc #> # A tibble: 21,000 × 12 #>    plate well  dye   target sample_type run   replicate amp_mix_perc   copies #>    <fct> <fct> <fct> <fct>  <fct>       <fct> <fct>            <dbl>    <int> #>  1 NA    NA    SYBR  MT-ND1 std         1     1                    1 31400000 #>  2 NA    NA    SYBR  MT-ND1 std         1     1                    1 31400000 #>  3 NA    NA    SYBR  MT-ND1 std         1     1                    1 31400000 #>  4 NA    NA    SYBR  MT-ND1 std         1     1                    1 31400000 #>  5 NA    NA    SYBR  MT-ND1 std         1     1                    1 31400000 #>  6 NA    NA    SYBR  MT-ND1 std         1     1                    1 31400000 #>  7 NA    NA    SYBR  MT-ND1 std         1     1                    1 31400000 #>  8 NA    NA    SYBR  MT-ND1 std         1     1                    1 31400000 #>  9 NA    NA    SYBR  MT-ND1 std         1     1                    1 31400000 #> 10 NA    NA    SYBR  MT-ND1 std         1     1                    1 31400000 #> # what: guescini: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Guescini et al. (2008) — guescini-package
title: guescini: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Guescini et al. (2008) — guescini-package
text: Real-time quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR) data Guescini et al. (2008) doi:10.1186/1471-2105-9-326  tidy format. package provides two data sets amplification efficiency modulated: either alterating amplification mix concentration, increasing concentration IgG, PCR inhibitor. Original raw data files: https://static-content.springer.com/esm/art%3A10.1186%2F1471-2105-9-326/MediaObjects/12859_2008_2311_MOESM1_ESM.xls https://static-content.springer.com/esm/art%3A10.1186%2F1471-2105-9-326/MediaObjects/12859_2008_2311_MOESM5_ESM.xls.
